detailed_info.name: Kaolin clay
detailed_info.description:
Kaolin is a white clay composed of aluminum silicates. It goes into the manufacture of paper or porcelain. The clay can be used in cosmetics as an active ingredient or as a white dye (CI 77004). Kaolin is used to relieve sensitive skin, keep white teeth, absorb and regulate excess sebum or fight against perspiration. Kaolin is allowed in organic.

Note that the CIR (American) has opened a new consultation (re-evaluation) of kaolin in May 2018.
detailed_info.regulation: When Kaolin clay is used as an active ingredient, it must be declared in the Inci list under the name KAOLIN, when used as a colorant it must be declared as CI 77004.

functions.name: Abrasive
functions.description: Removes materials from the surface of the body, helps clean teeth and improves shine.

functions.name: Absorbent
functions.description: Absorbs water (or oil) in dissolved or fine form

functions.name: Anticaking
functions.description: Helps ensure the fluidity of solid particles and limit their agglomeration in powder cosmetic products or hard mass cosmetics.

functions.name: Cosmetic colorant
functions.description: Color cosmetics and / or give a color to the skin

functions.name: Opacifying
functions.description: Reduces transparency or translucency of cosmetics
